verses.plain: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

tokens.t: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

verses.plain: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;

tokens.t: God liveth,
hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty,
hath vexed my soul;

verses.plain: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;

tokens.t: All the while my breath
in me, and the spirit of God
in my nostrils;

verses.plain: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.

tokens.t: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.

verses.plain: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

tokens.t: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

verses.plain: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.

tokens.t: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach
so long as I live.

verses.plain: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

tokens.t: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

verses.plain: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?

tokens.t: For what
the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?

verses.plain: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?

tokens.t: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?

verses.plain: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?

tokens.t: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?

verses.plain: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

tokens.t: I will teach you by the hand of God:
which
with the Almighty will I not conceal.

verses.plain: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

tokens.t: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen
why then are ye thus altogether vain?

verses.plain: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.

tokens.t: This
the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors,
they shall receive of the Almighty.

verses.plain: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

tokens.t: If his children be multiplied,
for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

verses.plain: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

tokens.t: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

verses.plain: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

tokens.t: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

verses.plain: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

tokens.t: He may prepare
, but the just shall put
on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

verses.plain: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.

tokens.t: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth
the keeper maketh.

verses.plain: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.

tokens.t: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he
not.

verses.plain: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

tokens.t: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

verses.plain: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.

tokens.t: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.

verses.plain: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.

tokens.t: For
shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.

verses.plain: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.

tokens.t: shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.

footnotes.text: continued: Heb. added to take up
vexed…: Heb. made my soul bitter
the spirit…: that is, the breath which God gave him
so long…: Heb. from my days
by…: or, being in the hand, etc
he…: Heb. in fleeing he would flee
